post.body: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python Zeronet: http://127.0.0.1:43110/automatetheboringstuff.bit/ IPFS: http://127.0.0.1:8080/ipfs/QmRNfCeLE8CXNHNMp15iraPusvbwVRMMfw7cvUxV6A2NMw/
Looks like bitcoin, but where's Zeronet on here?

comment.body: Hey, great work. I've been trying to get my own vids on some uploadable sites without joy. I was wondering whether you will let us in on how you are doing it? And perhaps let us clone IPFS Video? Please:-D

Thank you for the info. I had copied IPFS Video but not being familiar with Javascript I left that stuff alone. Makes sense now why I had a parsing error when I changed the video hash in the video_.html.
Thanks for all the help! Got some videos playing and some silly mistakes I have been making have become clear.

I've been wondering: how come IPFS Video is not totally on IPFS? I've been experimenting with Zeronet on and off for months and I've got to say I am a little disappointed. I can see you're working hard and don't want to see that work wasted. Take Zerotube for instance. Sometimes there's supposedly '200 peers' on that very zite, and yet it has practically nothing on it. I think the numbers are faked big time.
The Future
Ciao! http://127.0.0.1:43110/aycaramba.bit/
Yo! http://127.0.0.1:43110/aycaramba.bit/
My Newbie blog: the newbie things I've learnt
Yo! How's Oman?
I'd like to know as well. I've seen them used, but don't know if they work.
Here, http://127.0.0.1:43110/1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE but don't know how active it is.

You can search some of ZeroNet here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/kaffiene.bit/ and/or click 'Sites' hyperlink and then search the text page it sends you to for keywords. Kaffiene does not have all of ZeroNet as a new site owner has to send an email to developer.

The stats are a great idea @Brahman, although I don't believe them. I can't understand how Zerotube can have 100s of peers and hardly anyone posts or even searches. I think it is a technicality: former users that didn't switch ZeroNet off.
Find some sites. If you can't find anything interesting, make your own and share :) see: http://127.0.0.1:43110/aycaramba.bit for how.
"What does this mean?" is the beginning of discovery:-D More power to ya

@Flyman: I just use the wget command in Linux and download a clearnet website I'd like to use offline. Instructions here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/aycaramba.bit under 'Previous Posts'. Saves re-inventing the wheel: "Good artists copy, great artists -- appropriate".
This video needs to be banned.
no gain, no pain

older woman is experienced and she doesn’t want to waste her time with someone who acts like an immature college boy." - Do you have an Adult Android Dating section? I don't really get on with human beings.
